summary_short: Agnès Varda, photographer, installation artist and pioneer of the Nouvelle Vague, is an institution of French cinema. Taking a seat on a theatre stage, she uses photos and film excerpts to provide an insight into her unorthodox oeuvre.

The writer-director Trey Edward Shults tells the story of a family held together by love and nearly undone by tragedy. Traces the journey of a suburban family - led by a well-intentioned but domineering father - as they navigate love, forgiveness, and coming together in the aftermath of a loss.
Mati Diop’s Cannes prize winner is a potent mix of genres and moods.
Matt Damon and Christian Bale star in James Mangold’s look back at the golden age of auto racing.
Matt Wolf’s documentary shows how one woman captured history by recording television news. The results are compelling.
Errol Morris fails to crack his subject in this documentary — but maybe that’s the point.
Breathtakingly beautiful and with little spoken dialogue, Matthew Barney’s film is a western that reaches for the cosmic.
In this scorching movie from Nadav Lapid, a young Israeli flees to Paris and tries to transform into a Frenchman. It goes badly.
Naomie Harris plays a rookie running from bad police officers and drug dealers in Deon Taylor’s violent, astute film.
This concert film, directed by the singer and Thom Zimny, puts Bruce in a barn with an orchestra to make some magic.

display_title: Making Waves: The Art of Cinematic Sound
summary_short: A documentary provides vivid examples of the power of audio in a motion picture.
In footage shot over several years, this documentary follows a herd of elephants across the Kenyan savanna.
‘The Two Faces of a Bamileke Woman’ and ‘Chez Jolie Coiffure’ offer Cameroonian women the chance to speak for themselves. Two Films From Rosine Mbakam Explore West African Women’s Identity
